byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent), Claire Gatinois and Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv, correspondent)
subhed: Despite the US and Ukrainian presidents congratulating themselves about the outcome of their meeting on Sunday, the prospect of an agreement to end the nearly four-year war between Kyiv and Moscow still seems far off.

China announces 'major' military exercises around Taiwan
subhed: Beijing's latest show of force follows a round of arms sales to Taipei by the United States. Taiwan's Defense Ministry condemned China as the 'greatest destroyer of peace,' and the Taiwanese military said it had established a response center with 'appropriate forces.'

title: Municipal elections: Louis Sarkozy tries to make a splash in French Riviera town
subhed: The son of the former French president is running a headline-grabbing campaign in Mention, both on the ground and across social media, as he tries to make a name for himself in a city where the far right enjoys strong support.

title: 2025: A bleak year for jobs in the telecom sector in Europe and the US
subhed: Telecom operators and equipment manufacturers have cut tens of thousands of jobs. Fierce competition, difficulties in making 5G profitable, and the rapid digitalization of roles in the sector are driving the trend.

title: 'From sex appeal to the far right': Brigitte Bardot's death in the international press
byline: By Minh Dréan and Romain Del Bello
subhed: International media outlets paid tribute to Bardot, who died on Sunday, celebrating her film career and her social influence from the 1950s onward, yet also calling out her political choices, which later drifted toward the far right.

subhed: Convicted five times for racist remarks, the actress – whose foundation announced her death on Sunday, December 28 – remained one of the only French celebrities to openly embrace far-right views.

title: Trump, the Apocalypse and King David: A theological reading of the US president
subhed: Since his first term, the American president has frequently made apocalyptic and messianic references. Some supporters compare him to biblical figures such as King David, appealing particularly to evangelical Christians, who make up about one-fifth of Americans.

title: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhed: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.
